item.title: [HBASE-7738] REST server should publish metrics that are available via HTTP
item.description: The REST server should publish metrics that are accessible via HTTP (/metrics or /jmx) much like a bunch of the other Hadoop daemons, especially it is a Jetty server.
item.summary: REST server should publish metrics that are available via HTTP

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
+1 patches look good, thanks Jimmy.

Out of curiosity, what is deprecated?
In Hadoop 1 MetricsServlet is deprecated in favor of org.apache.hadoop.metrics2. However, it is not marked deprecated in trunk, or branch-2.
Thanks.
Won't this mess with any table named metrics?

Won't this mess with any table named metrics?

Yes, and one named "jmx". Not dis-similar to how /status and /version are also reserved. See RootResource. I assume this is acceptable and can be documented with the others. If actually undesirable, then one option is to move them under /status.
Yes, users should not use the following as a table name: metrics, jmx, version, or status. Is there a way to avoid such issue?

Is there a way to avoid such issue?

We'd need to preserve /status and /version for backwards compatibility but otherwise you could prepend a sigil to these administrative path roots, something less likely to collide with a name a user might choose for a table.
All other hadoop servers use /metrics and /jmx, for example, HMaster and region server. Probably we should ask users not to use metrics/jmx as table name, to avoid confusion.

If actually undesirable, then one option is to move them under /status.

That seems better. Seems like we should try and minimize the number of names that are reserved.

Or should we make a breaking change ( using the ever present singularity reasoning) and mount TableResource's under a different path (/tables ?) so that there are no reserved table names.

Or should we make a breaking change ( using the ever present singularity reasoning) and mount TableResource's under a different path (/tables ?) so that there are no reserved table names.

For that I recommend HBASE-2677

How about we make them configurable, and default to metrics/jmx?

Configurable seems fine for 0.94. However I think going forward, 0.96+, we should fix the reserved table names issue completely in 0.96 so that the configuration isn't even needed. Looks like HBASE-2677 is a better place for that larger fix.

Looks like HBASE-2677 is a better place for that larger fix.

I would agree, and changing path mapping can be done independent of any new/better representations, though that makes sense to do too, especially if we can cut the cord to the old types given the "singularity" rationale. The REST representation predates when KeyValue was introduced. We don't have any Avro support in 0.96 anymore but this would be a good vehicle to put it back. The representations have limits that were acceptable for a first drop but should be reworked so large result sets can be chunked/streamed back.
